data.name: FillCommentSelectionError
data.value:
Fill Comment Paragraph fills the text in a contiguous block of comment lines or multiline strings.
It must be invoked on a comment line or within a triple quoted line.

data.name: UnresolvedModuleTooltipRefreshing
data.value: Unable to resolve "{0}". The completion DB for the active environment needs to be refreshed, and IntelliSense may be missing until that has completed. See the Python Environments window for details.

data.name: UpgradedToolsVersion
data.value: The tools version has been changed to 4.0. This will not affect compatibility with other versions of Visual Studio.

data.name: WebLauncherArgumentsHelp
data.value: Specifies arguments which are passed to the script and available via sys.argv.

data.name: WebLauncherInterpreterArgumentsHelp
data.value: Specifies arguments which alter how the interpreter is started (for example, -O to generate optimized byte code).

data.name: WebLauncherInterpreterPathHelp
data.value: Overrides the interpreter executable which is used for launching the project.

data.name: WebLauncherLaunchUrlHelp
data.value: The URL to open in the browser when starting the development server. When not specified http://localhost will be launched.

data.name: WebLauncherPortNumberHelp
data.value: The port on which the development server should listen. When not specified a random free port will be used. The SERVER_PORT environment variable is set to this value.

data.name: WebLauncherSearchPathHelp
data.value: Specifies additional directories which are added to sys.path for making libraries available for importing.

data.name: WebLauncherDebugServerArgumentsHelp
data.value: Any command line arguments to provide. This is ignored if the command type is "code".

data.name: WebLauncherDebugServerEnvironmentHelp
data.value: Environment variables to set before starting the server. Each value should appear on its own line in "KEY=VALUE" format. By default, SERVER_HOST and SERVER_PORT are set.

data.name: WebLauncherDebugServerTargetHelp
data.value: The command to run when pressing F5 or the "Start debug server" command. This may be a script, module, or a single line of Python code. By default, the current startup script is used.

data.name: WebLauncherDebugServerTargetTypeHelp
data.value: The type of the command. If no command is specified, this value is always treated as "script".

data.name: WebLauncherRunServerArgumentsHelp
data.value: Any command line arguments to provide. This is ignored if the command type is "code".

data.name: WebLauncherRunServerEnvironmentHelp
data.value: Environment variables to set before starting the server. Each value should appear on its own line in "KEY=VALUE" format. By default, SERVER_HOST and SERVER_PORT are set.

data.name: WebLauncherRunServerTargetHelp
data.value: The command to run when pressing Ctrl+F5 or the "Start server" command. This may be a script, module, or a single line of Python code. By default, the current startup script is used.

data.name: WebLauncherRunServerTargetTypeHelp
data.value: The type of the command. If no command is specified, this value is always treated as "script".
